thread.title: In a costly loss, Azkals fall to Bahrain
thread.title_full: In a costly loss, Azkals fall to Bahrain | mb.com.ph | Philippine News

author: Jonas Terrado
title: In a costly loss, Azkals fall to Bahrain
text:
by Jonas Terrado
October 15, 2015 Game on Nov. 12
(Rizal Memorial Stadium)
8 p.m. – Philippines vs Yemen
The Philippine Azkals suffered a major blow in their ambitious World Cup bid after losing 2-0 to Bahrain in the second round of the qualifiers last Tuesday at the Bahrain National Stadium in Manama.
Ismaael Abdullatif made the Azkals defense pay for leaving him unmarked and scored the opening goal near the six-yard box in the 53rd minute before Sayed Mohamed Adnan netted a curling free kick in the 61st to seal the Bahrainis victory.
Playing below par after its hard-fought scoreless draw with unbeaten North Korea last week in Pyongyang, the Filipinos wasted a golden chance at restoring their hold of the second spot to remain at third place in Group H.
With seven points after five matches, the Azkals trail Uzbekistan by two points with the latter having a game at hand.
The defeat put the Azkals in a dire situation as they must win their remaining three matches to advance not only to the third round of the World Cup qualifiers but also secure a spot in the prestigious 2019 Asian Cup.
They are fancied to beat Yemen at the Rizal Memorial Stadium on Nov. 12 but must beat Uzbekistan and North Korea to fulfill their mission.
The top team in Group H advances to the third round of the qualifiers while the runner-up of the group must emerge as one of four best second placers to likewise progress to the next phase.
The Azkals entered the game with their confidence soaring after the surprise draw against North Korea. They also beat the Bahrainis 2-1 last June at the Philippine Sports Stadium in Bulacan.
In fact, the Filipinos had numerous chances to score in the first half, with Phil Younghusband nearly heading home the opener off a right cross by Stephan Schrock.
But Bahrain found cracks on the Philippine defense which eventually resulted in Abdullatif’s goal that came off a short pass by teammate Sami Alhussaini.
Adnan then capitalize on an Azkals foul when his shot off a wall of defenders caught Etheridge by surprise to double Bahrain’s lead.
